AND THERE’S SOME SNOW LOVERS THAT WOULD REALLY LIKE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF IT, BUT WE JUST DON’T HAVE ANY IN THE C Advertisement Snow totals: See how much snow fell in eastern Iowa Snow continues to fall across eastern and southeastern portions of Iowa on Thursday night. This has led to roads throughout eastern Iowa being reported as partially to completely covered with snow with slick conditions.Snow will continue to fall Thursday night, with 1-3" possible through southeastern Iowa. Some locations have already picked up nearly 3".Here are the current snowfall totals:3.3" — Lowden, IA 2.0" — Wyoming, IA2.0" — Park View, IA1.8" — 1 N of Marion, IA1.8" — Olin, IA1.7" — Dubuque Regional Arpt, IA1.6" — 1 WSW of New London, IA1.5" — 2 NNW North Liberty, IA0.5" — 2 SSE of Buck Creek, IA3" — 1 W of Sigourney, IA1.3" — 2 WNW of Dubuque, IA 0" — 5 NNE of Washington, IA1.0" — Davenport Airport, IA 0.1" — Cedar Rapids, IA Snow continues to fall across eastern and southeastern portions of Iowa on Thursday night. This has led to roads throughout eastern Iowa being reported as partially to completely covered with snow with slick conditions. Snow will continue to fall Thursday night, with 1-3" possible through southeastern Iowa. Some locations have already picked up nearly 3".
